p: The maximum dose of benzoic acid (and other benzoates, calculated as benzoic acid) recommended by WHO is 5 mg/kg body weight per day in adults, a dose that, in children, logically, should be much lower [ 29, 35]. As the effects on new-borns are severely toxic, the U.S. FDA has recommended the exclusion of benzyl alcohol from medications, intravenous fluids, and heparin washing solutions for them [ 36]. The EMA states that any medicine containing benzyl alcohol “should not be given to premature babies and new-borns” [ 42, 43]. In fact, currently, any exposure to benzyl alcohol is contraindicated in children under 3 years of age [ 44].
